@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mixin used for the bubbling events. If you want to use this in your own model classes, be sure that every property will call the {@link #_applyEventPropagation} function on every change.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The change event which will be fired on every change in the model no matter what property changes. This event bubbles so the root model will fire a change event on every change of its children properties too. Note that properties are required to call {@link #_applyEventPropagation} on apply for changes to be tracked as desired. It is already taken care of that properties created with the {@link qx.data.marshal.Json} marshaler call this method. The data will contain a map with the following four keys

  • value: The new value of the property
  • old: The old value of the property.
  • name: The name of the property changed including its parent properties separated by dots.
  • item: The item which has the changed property.
    • Due to that, the getOldData method will always return null because the old data is contained in the map.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply function for every property created with the {@link qx.data.marshal.Json} marshaler. It fires and {@link #changeBubble} event on every change. It also adds the chaining listener if possible which is necessary for the bubbling of the events.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var} The new value of the property.
@param.description: The new value of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {var} The old value of the property.
@param.description: The old value of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the changed property.
@param.description: The name of the changed property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Registers for the given parameters the changeBubble listener, if possible. It also removes the old listener, if an old item with a changeBubble event is given.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var} The new value of the property.
@param.description: The new value of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: old {var} The old value of the property.
@param.description: The old value of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the changed property.
@param.description: The name of the changed property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener responsible for formating the name and firing the change event for the changed property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the former properties.
@param.description: The name of the former properties.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
e {qx.event.type.Data} The date event fired by the property
   change.
@param.description:
The date event fired by the property
   change.
